payments.description: A surcharge fee has been charged for this payment because it failed or got charged back.

payments.description: A request to resubmit the payment was made by the payment retry endpoint. This can also mean that the payment was automatically scheduled for resubmission by GoCardless if you have opted in for the intelligent retries feature.

details.description: An attempt to retry this payment was requested.
The payment was scheduled for resubmission automatically by GoCardless.

payments.description: The payment could not be collected usually because the customer did not have sufficient funds available. GoCardless will automatically retry the payment if event'swill_attempt_retryfield is true. See the intelligent retries section below.

details.description: The customer's account had insufficient funds to make this payment.

payments.description: The payment has been collected from the customer's bank account and is now being held by GoCardless. It can take up to 5 working days for a payment to be collected and will then be held for a short time before becomingpaid_out.

creditors.description: This creditor account has been automatically frozen and had restrictions applied.

details.description: This creditor account has been automatically frozen and had restrictions applied.

creditors.description: Something has changed about this creditor. The property that has changed will be included in the event details. Currently this webhook is sent forlogo_urlverification_statusmandate_imports_enabledcustom_payment_pages_enabledandmerchant_responsible_for_notifications.

details.description: This creditor has been updated.

creditors.description: This creditor accounts restrictions have been removed.

mandates.description: The mandate has become active again after it was cancelled or expired. This can be due to the customer's bank wishing to undo a cancellation or expiry notice they sent or because the mandate was successfully reinstated via the reinstate endpoint.

details.description: The time window after submission for the banks to refuse a mandate has ended without any errors being received so this mandate is now active.
A cancelled mandate has been re-instated by the customer's bank.

mandates.description: The mandate required additional approval from the customer (e.g. permission from a second signatory) and that approval has been granted.

details.description: The customer has granted approval for this mandate

mandates.description: No collection attempts were made against the mandate within the dormancy period of your service user number. As a result it has expired and no further collections can be taken against it. If you wish to continue taking payments from this customer you should request their permission and use the reinstate endpoint.

details.description: The mandate is being marked as expired because no payments have been collected against it for the dormancy period of your service user number. If you have access to the mandate reinstation API endpoint you can use this to attempt to set this mandate up again.
This mandate was cancelled by the customer or their bank.
The mandate has expired.

mandates.description: The mandate has been submitted to the banks and should become active in a few days unless the bank declines the request.

details.description: The mandate has been submitted to the banks.
The customer's bank account was transferred to a different bank or building society.

mandates.description: The mandate has been transferred to a different bank account either using a bank switching service (where it is supported) or with help from GoCardless Support when a customer asks to change their bank account (we can make the switch after verifying the details). The event will includelinks[previous_customer_bank_account]andlinks[new_customer_bank_account]. When using a bank switching service the mandate may have been submitted again depending on how the involved banks handled the transfer.

details.description: The customer's bank account was transferred to a different bank or building society.
This mandate was transferred to a new bank account through GoCardless.

mandates.description: The mandate has been used to create a payment and has now been consumed. It cannot be used again.

details.description: The mandate has been used to create a payment and has now been consumed. It cannot be used again.

mandates.description: The mandate originally was believed to require additional approval from the customer (e.g. permission from a second signatory) but approval has been skipped (for example because the mandate was erroneously marked as needing a second signature).

details.description: The customer has skipped approval for this mandate

mandates.description: The mandate has been successfully set up by the customer's bank.

details.description: The time window after submission for the banks to refuse a mandate has ended without any errors being received so this mandate is now active.
The customer's bank has confirmed that this mandate has been activated.
Mandate created via the API.
Mandate created by a bulk change

mandates.description: The mandate has been blocked because the customer's details matched against an entry in either our global blocklist or the blocklist populated by you. This mandate cannot be unblocked and no payments can be created against it. If you still wish to collect payments from this customer you will need to remove their details from any blocks you have created and ask them to set up a new mandate. If you contacted GoCardless to block the customer's details you will need to make a request to unblock them.

details.description: The mandate has been blocked because the customer's details matched against an entry in the blocklist populated by you.
The mandate has been blocked because the customer's details matched against an entry in our global blocklist.

mandates.description: The mandate has been cancelled and replaced by a new mandate (for example because the creditor has moved to a new Service User Number). The event will includelinks[new_mandate]with the ID of the new mandate.

details.description: The creditor has changed to a different scheme identifier so this mandate has been cancelled and replaced by a new one.

mandates.description: The mandate has been cancelled either by the customer through their bank or this API or automatically when their bank account is closed.

refunds.description: The refund has been credited in a payout. Thedetails[cause]will berefund_funds_returnedand thedetails[origin]will begocardless.

details.description: The funds for the refund have been returned to you.

refunds.description: The refund did not reach your customer the funds will be returned to you. Thedetails[cause]will berefund_failedand thedetails[origin]will begocardless.It is important to note that the ‘failed' and ‘refund_settled' events are not associated. A refund can fail even after it's been settled. If a refund fails GoCardless has attempted to refund the customer and has already deducted the applicable funds from one of your payouts. The refund has then subsequently failed to reach the customer. If this occurs the funds will be returned to you.

details.description: The refund did not reach your customer the funds will be returned to you.

refunds.description: The refund has been paid to your customer. Thedetails[cause]will berefund_paidand thedetails[origin]will begocardless.

details.description: The refund has been paid to your customer.

refunds.description: A refund has been created. Thedetails[cause]will bepayment_refundedand thedetails[origin]will beapi.

details.description: The refund has been created and will be submitted in the next batch.
The refund has been created and will be submitted in the next batch.

refunds.description: The refund has been deducted from a payout. Thedetails[cause]will berefund_settledand thedetails[origin]will begocardless.

details.description: The refund has been deducted from a payout.

payouts.description: The tax exchange rates for all payout items of the payout have been confirmed. This event will only exist if the payout has atax_currencyand if itstax_currencyis different from itscurrency. It will be created once all fees in the payout are invoiced.

details.description: The exchange rates for the taxes (such as VAT) that applied to GoCardless fees deducted from the payout have all been confirmed and will not change.

payouts.description: The exchange rate for the payout has been confirmed and will not change.

details.description: The exchange rate for the payout has been confirmed and will not change. Only sent for FX payouts.

payouts.description: GoCardless has transferred the payout to the creditor's bank account. Thedetails[cause]will always bepayout_paidand thedetails[origin]will begocardless.

details.description: GoCardless has transferred the payout to the creditor's bank account. FX payouts will emit this event but will continue to have a pending status until we emit the payout_fx_rate_confirmed event.
